website_summaries.verdict: A good value for homeowners with backyard and garden wood-chipping tasks.
pros: Easy to use and maneuver, yet capable of handling branches up to 1.5 inches in diameter
Compact design is ideal for tasks like making garden mulch
cons: Not good at mulching leaves or heavy-duty brush

customer_reviews.title: Good for small branches
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a solid machine, good for small stuff... Don't expect to shred any bigger than 1 inch. Use it once for about 3 hr so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: All you really need...
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me you have looked at getting a chipper/shredder for some time. From the "cheap electric" to the premium gas/electric. Yes, you can buy an electric chipper for $1000+ (Patriot). BUT when all is said and done you are probably cleaning up a few small branches in the fall, or cleaning up when you trim your bushes. Do not purchase if you think you want to shred leaves. This really is a "branch" kind of thing. The opening is the one downside, albeit bearable. You will need a bucket or a rubbermaid container to catch the chips, or you can just shoot it on the ground. Overall great chipper for the average homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great wood chips
customer_reviews.text: I trimmed 3 cherry trees and 2 apple trees in my back yard. Needless to say I have a large pile of branches..etc...It did exactly what i thought it would do.....Great wood chips, that I will use in my smoker in months to come . Thank you I would highly recommend this chipper shredder to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk.  Support is not responding.
customer_reviews.text: Shut off within 5 minutes of first use and won't restart. Used proper cord, cleared and secured hopper, hit reset button...nothing. Help line didn't pick up after endless ringing. Called back local number and after 10 minutes decided to request callback. Never got a call back. Sent email on website with automated, non helpful reply. Website and phone line refer to non-existent support chat button. Bottom line. It chipped wood adequately for less than 5 minutes, and now it won't restart, and support is inaccessible. Like others have stated, the build in flimsy plastic but the blades appear adequate. First and last Sun Joe product for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dog House

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the chipper so far. It does not like branches that are not dried. It will plug up with wet branches so operator needs to be aware of that. Once it is plugged it can be a little obstinate to get going again. However a thorough cleaning and a few well place cuss words seem to get it going again. The key to any equipment is its longevity and that remains to be seen. Suspect that as long as it is not abused should last quite a while. It sure chews up branches.
customer_reviews.author: AWB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty efficient little wood shredder
customer_reviews.text: I used the Sun Joe to shred branches and twigs in my backyard. I was amazed at how efficient it was at shredding. Pros: Quick at shredding branches Can shred some pretty thick branches Doesn’t overheat or shutdown like a lot of other products I like the color Really easy to use and pretty safe Cons: Wish it had a little more space for me to slip a bucket under to collect the mulch. It won’t shred tiny twigs Overall I was impressed, it’s a good addition to my backyard equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Khonje

customer_reviews.title: Performed as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Sun Joe because I have 8 large crepe myrtles that I had pruned and had a yard full of trimmings. I am seriously impressed with this electric chipper. Used it for about 6 hours today. It’ll chip anything that fits in the opening. For stuff over an inch and half I would feed a little at time until it got under an inch and a half and then I could let it self feed without any problems. I had purchased another brand that had a stamped steel mini lawnmower type blade it it was completely useless and returned it. This unit has two separate machined blocks of sharpened steel.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri F

customer_reviews.title: I like the Chipper Joe Units
customer_reviews.text: I compost my own gardening soil and these units grind branches into coarse sized sawdust. This is my second Chipper Joe; the first was a CJ601E which lasted for 4 years of heavier than normal use. An internal AC/DC converter burned-out. I might try to repair it some day. The CJ602E operates differently in that the cutting action pulls the branches in quickly. The 601E needed the operator to feed the cutter by shoving the branches in. Both make the same size chips. Branches up to 1.25" are fine. It's not industrial machinery; use it moderately and you'l get your money's worth. I would gladly pay $200 for a slightly more robust version that made the same size wood chips.
customer_reviews.author: Ray C.

customer_reviews.title: great little machine, easy to use and move around
customer_reviews.text: love it... it turned a pile of branched 6 feet high and 8 feet long and 8 feet wide into great much in no time very easy to use i used it for 3 hr. straight and it NEVER jammed, bog down or had any problem at all... i read all the review and i was expecting to have some problem but thankfully i never did... there was a bit of a learning curve when inserting the branches so it doesn't whip around and smack you in the head but after a few good wack i got the hang of it...
customer_reviews.author: yinn2yangTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Company didn't back their product.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this device until it abruptly stopped working. I couldn't get the reset button to work, so I assumed that that was the problem. When I called Sun Joe for help, they told me that they couldn't help and also couldn't tell me about any local repair shops that could help me. I purchased this product in August of 2018, so it isn't even a year old. I am frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Lon Stamper

customer_reviews.title: Dull blades within 30 minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: I was going to clear up some smaller brush, but this machine just can't handle even 1/2" diameter sticks - dry or green. The blade is dull after about 30 minutes of use and just spits out the finer twigs without even chopping them up. I tried to re-feed them through, but they just spit out in 8-12" lengths. I was thinking that sharpening the blades would be an option, but the steel is not even worth sharpening. So cheap. I'm so bummed. I'll have to return this one and take the brush to the dump.
customer_reviews.author: gderp

customer_reviews.title: Great for twigs
customer_reviews.text: Great for twigs, small sticks and small branches. NOTHING ELSE! It says leaves, weeds and grass but you have to feed them in the totally inadequate feeding tube no more than a small handful at a time. My best advice to anyone considering this make and model chipper shredder is to spend your money elsewhere. Don't make the same mistake I did by purchasing this item.
customer_reviews.author: D. DUKE

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to mulch small branches. It was inexpensive, small, easy to unjam, and a year later, still running fine. I included a video with this review.
customer_reviews.author: John Stilwell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chipper
customer_reviews.text: I have used this with significant trimmings from two tree so far--It does an excellent job on branches and the attached leaves. It will jam up if you leave too many leaves at the small end of the branch. As long as you limit how many leaves are being stuffed into machine it worked flawlessly and efficiently. I would highly recommend this unit as a chipper.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL ROSENBLATT

customer_reviews.title: Garage, trash, junk, 💩 updated 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time, this thing broke after 20 minutes of light use. Have to return and wait another 2 f ing weeks to get a new one. It took a week to get the new one but this one held up to the job I bought it for. So in the long run it saved me several hundred dollars because I didn’t have to hire someone to cut up the tree and get rid of it. Used it again today and got rid of a brush pile. It took 3 1/2 hrs but man it worked great. The next time I have to use it I will have to change out the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: No replacement blades
customer_reviews.text: This product works really well right up to the point you need a replacement blade. At that point, you have to put it on the curb and let it go to the dump, because you won't be able to find a replacement blade. Understand that if you buy this, it has a very short shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: If only all sticks were straight!!
customer_reviews.text: It does everything described, but curved or bent sticks are it's nemesis. It takes very large sticks up to the 1.6" listed which is the best. It falls down when a stick has a bend and is firm, it won't feed in. This leads to a lot of pre-work prep to get sticks in a shape / state ready for processing by the chipper. At some point, it's more hassle than just taking sticks to the dump but it's a nice convenient light duty item. Good -- yes, great -- no. The next step up is $600-$700 so it's a great price point to get started in the wood chipping biz :)
customer_reviews.author: SFtodo-Dot-Com

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: It is better than expected! Of course it is struggling with bigger branches but anything less than 1" goes right through and branches don't have to be super straight like some reviews were saying. It is a home chipper for about $100 so it does the job I need it to do for sure. I would recommend for anyone that has some maintenance pruning to do and want to just chip away and use for mulch or in compost. I am very happy with my little wood chipper!
customer_reviews.author: Johanne

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: OK, if you're looking for something to shred leaves, you should move on. The opening is not large enough to get any quantity of leaves inside. That being said, this little monster will chip just about anything you can fit down it's throat. I honestly did not expect this little electric chipper to have this much power. I would recommend this to any home owner that can't justify a $600 gas powered unit. I am very happy with this purchase. The only thing that I would suggest to the designer would be to make this unit about 2" taller, so It's easier to fit a bucket under for catching the mulch.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from CJ601E to CJ602E.  Do NOT put vines in this.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the CGJ601E because the motor blew out after 2.5 years of use. The motor probably blew out because vines would get stuck in the blades, stopping them and seizing up the engine. I'm only going to be cutting branches and dry leaves from now on. The CJ602E is almost exactly like the CJ601E, except it has an 1 extra amp of power. It certainly feels like that extra 1 amp is doing a better job, because I don't remember the CJ601E shredding the twigs and sticks as fast and efficiently as the CJ602E. Overall, very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: David T

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this. Realize it for what it is - not an industrial machine, but for small branches. For those who say it jams, you need stay with the thin branches. I found, especially with hard wood that you need to feed it. Hold onto the stick while pushing it in (for the 1.5" sticks) and pull it up a bit if you feel/hear it struggling. Thin stuff and pine goes right through it, no problem. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Web Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK WITH FIBROUS OR WET MATERIAL
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad to have this useful tool. I will be able to convert nuisance treefall into mulch for probably quite a while. The green color will make this chipper easy to store. If you want to convert palm fronds or ivy into mulch, do not buy this chipper. You can convert wet leaves if you intersperse them with dry branchlings. This machine does not like branches over .75 inches and will not accept anything fibrous like a palm. The tedious procedure of opening the hopper to clear it ( About thirty turns of a knob. Why not a single latch? ) will learn you this lesson.
customer_reviews.author: S Truitt

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to put together. The "wrench" they provided wasn't very good, so I did have to use my own tools. No problem with that though. I had some small branches piled up for a week and ran them through. You will have to trim them to make straighter branches, don't think you can shove a branch with a bunch of forks in and it will take it. Once I got the hand of it, the dried branches grinded up nicely. I haven't pushed any fresh cuttings through yet, and the ones I did weren't but half inch in diameter. I like the fact that it is light weight and there is zero maintenance on it.
customer_reviews.author: Threedog

customer_reviews.title: For a bit over $100, really good product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little chipper. My pile tipped over due to high winds. I was able to cut it down enormously. First photo was the pile originally blown over. Second is the pile after I got done, what was left. Third picture is the mulch that came out of this machine. It's a beast for the price. Gas powered are so expensive, & dangerous. With all the safety guarding that's on it, I feel safe doing it with kids around. My only complaint is the longer pine needles have a tendency to get stuck in down spout, but that's easy to get out.
customer_reviews.author: JT_JUMPER

customer_reviews.title: Don't overload it and it will work fine
customer_reviews.text: Do not overload it and it will work fine. If you chip vines and thing green twigs you may get some twine like build up and will need to open up blade access and clean it out. You will be able to hear a slowdown in the motor when this happens. This is not a gas powered chipper so do not expected it to do what a $500+ gas chipper will do. Excellent value and does what is is designed for.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Worf

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Using it to chip a lot of cedar tree branches. Branches up to 1" get eaten up like they are nothing. The larger branches I go slower and it seems to handle it just fine so far. Just be sure to clear out the debris below. I wasn't paying attention and it started to clog the machine because it piled up so high. I could hear it making a lower pitch noise and realized the problem. I unplugged it and reach in to clear it. Worked fine after that. Saved some money on getting a gently used red one (I don't care about the color). Very easy to assemble and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: E. Yerxa

customer_reviews.title: My new toy and love it !
customer_reviews.text: I had this for about 7 months. It has made my life easier in the back yard. I have used it to mulch limbs up to 1 inch thick depending on the type of wood hardness. Shrubs are amazing because it will reduce the void space due to thick vines. What would take 3 full 60 gal containers of green waste can fit into one 60 gal container. Just rotate blades when one side wears out. Eventually will need to take it to sharpen. I must have put 60 hours and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO
customer_reviews.text: It is a pile. It literally did not run longer than 5 minutes and would not take in the smallest of plant stalks that were dry. It started smoking. That is a nope! Returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: GT350

customer_reviews.title: Good wood chipper for what it is meant for
customer_reviews.text: Works great for what I needed. I use it mostly to shred honeysuckle branches between .25 and 1.5 inches in diameter. Bigger than that, I use a chainsaw to chop them up into firepit wood. Smaller than that, I just leave them on the grass and mow them. If you are expecting this to have the power of a gas chipper, you will probably be disappointed, but if you have realistic expectations, this is for you. PS. you will want some work gloves and safety glasses for when you use this.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pursley

customer_reviews.title: Used once worked fine, used a second time died.
customer_reviews.text: The chipped appeared to be working fine the first time I used it. It didn't take any branches nearly up to 1 inch but other than that it was fine. The second time I used it after the first jam and automatic shutoff (which happens a lot) it no longer works. Attempted all of the various fixes but it is now dead. It is past the 30 day return so no I have to apply for the warranty (outside of Amazon). Do not buy. SnowJoe (the company) has been very good to work with and responsive. It is possible I got a bad one or something.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewing

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this chipper to deal with the pruned branches and storm fall in my yard (several flowering shrubs that require cutting every year, silver maples that shed lots of sticks). Haven't had any issues, no jams that weren't quick and easy to clear. It was easy to put together with minimal tools, and easy to use if you follow instructions. I've even been able to use what it produces as mulching for some of my informal garden areas, a nice bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm for most sticks and branches within the recommended thickness. I used it mostly on hardwoods, so it did dull the blades faster I think than softwood would do. But I got lots of wood chips. The only thing it did not do well on was green, very thin branches. These didn't get cut, but were sucked through and skinned some. Dry branches would probably have worked better. We did buy replacement blades, and they were easy to replace. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: The Baker Family

customer_reviews.title: Missing critical parts
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that it showed up missing a critical component! The shredder stand assembly is not in the box which makes this unusable. I needed this today and now how long will it take... Update: It took a week to get my missing part shipped to me but I'm up and running a couple of days now and it's working really well for the price paid. Customer support was spectacular by the way. Itis supposed to handle up to 1 1/2" but that is under optimum conditions. All in all I would absolutely reccomend this for small projects. Mine happens to be an entire tree plus but it's holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: This clogged multiple times with each of my attempted uses. It may chip perfect size and texture poles but it absolutely does not work for gardening. It can't take leaves on branches, it only works for a few minutes before clogging. I hope they make a new design and stop selling this, because anyone who buys this will just take up space in their storage. Total failure of a garden tool. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: S Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Very good for light duty.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the sort of machine you can run entire branches through without a bit of preparation. I've been going through my brush pile with a hatchet, knocking off side branches and such. Thus far, anything that will fit through the opening has gone right through without complaint, so long as it is straight. The only jams I've had have been large branches with sharp kinks. Clearing jams is easy, and more or less idiot proof -- the chipper won't start until the hopper is securely closed. All in all I've been very pleased. I was ready to be disappointed, but not so far!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Terrel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected. Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Did exactly what I bought it for and chipped a big pile of twigs and branches into about .75 cu.yd. of mulch in about an hour and a half. Fairly slow, you have to feed one piece at a time. Struggles with branches/knots/nodes that approach 1.5 inches in diameter (and that's the limit of what it's rated for). I only had to unclog when I really forced stuff in it - which I expexted. Will edit if I break it or it gives up.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Great chipper
customer_reviews.text: I've used this several times thus far..I'm using mostly dried limbs I find around the woods which appear to chip better than fresh cut. I would advise letting fresh cut stuff dry out some before chipping at any thickness. My main purpose is to chip up just enough to cover a few inches of my chicken coop run which works great. Chickens love the chips and I do not have to constantly seek out chips for it. Blades appear easy to remove and sharpen and easy to take care of jams if they happen.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for - don't expect too much
customer_reviews.text: This is OK for shredding twigs, but if you let it chew on an inch diameter green pine branch it isn't going to keep running. If you let the branches dry out then you have to deal with all the dead leaves separately, which makes it a much bigger job. I used a short extension and a 5kW generator to run it, so there was no shortage of power, but it bogged down on even small branches. We will use it for trimmings, but we obviously need a gas powered chipper for the small branches we prune off the trees to keep the drive open.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Where has this product been? Thank goodness I found it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Lightweight. Powerful. Demolishes tree clippings. Remember what a pain it is to get cuttings into the required size and bundled for pickup (or bagged) - well forget it. This solves those issues. Once I figured out the proper technique I zoomed through the waste. Rather than let the chips fall where they may, I took my lawnmower bag, put a bungee cord on it and it captures the chips for easy disposal (see photo). This device is wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Douglas K. Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Great lighter duty product
customer_reviews.text: If you are trying to deal with normal debris, this product is excellent. Incredibly easy to assemble (took 5-10 minutes), and felt safe to use. I ran through some bamboo stalks that were really pushing the size limitations and it took it like a champ (the dryer stuff churned up to sawdust, green shredded into mulch). Very thin bits needed some nudging. It's not going to take the massive logs, but for regular branches under 2" in diameter, it did great.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Miller

customer_reviews.title: It's OK!
customer_reviews.text: This does what it advertises. 99% of my branches were old Pine that has been lying around for several years. After three full wheel barrels full, I had to switch around the blades, (not a huge chore). Most of my branches were an inch to an inch and a half. It will do crooked branches. I would recommend this for a homeowner that need to get rid of fallen branches of trimmings. This is not great for brush.
customer_reviews.author: Curbynf

customer_reviews.title: This chipper is a small beast
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 14 amp sun joe a few years ago and promptly returned it. This one seemed much more powerful and took care some 1 and 1/2” pieces without much problem. I give it a four star because the paddle holder snapped as I was putting it on. I may contact the vendor to see if they send me another piece and I don’t hold too much hope for it even if they offer a replacement. Other than this little issue, this sun joe might be a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: George1960

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, It is small. It isn't for big jobs, but it works well and it is great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great buy, It is small. It isn't for big jobs, but it works well and it is great for the price. I have done a lot of chipping. I put in a lot of green wood with leaves and bends and branches. I ran through some max size branches. It ate them. I had to open it once and cut out some think vines that were wrapped up around the blades, but I expected more jams than only one. I bought the extended warranty - 5 years of wood chipping for around $150 (with the warranty, I can't remember exactly what I paid). I think it is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Check it works before assembly
customer_reviews.text: Well that was a real disappointment. It was easy to put together and then I took it outside to use it and nothing. I think it might be related to the safety feature for when the hopper is opened. I was not going to take the unit apart to figure that out and then end up making a bigger mess. One thought if you buy one: Try it first before you snap on the wheel hub covers. I was afraid I would break them if I took them off, so I had some difficulty repackaging it to for return. Perhaps a better thought, is to buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Carter

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thinking I could get a large amount of small diameter wood shavings for my home but it just doesn't do the job. after a week of using this chipper developed an issue where it makes long strips of bark instead of chipping the wood. branches get stuck often and it has to be taken apart to get it to work again. Branches aren't always straight and if you have a bend in your branch it won't take it so you're ending up with a large number of small pieces where it would not fit in the small hole. But if you want to only chip small twigs and leaves this works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Ehmke

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know why this product is a best seller and received 4 stars. I assembled mine with moderate difficulty (the directions were a tad confusing) but once I tried it out it did nothing but spit out the boxwood leaves without shredding them. The hopper is abysmally small and the feeding slot is about 2" wide. You practically have to feed in leaves tiny batches at a time. The only reason I bought it was that I wanted it to shred material for composting and didn't have to ask my husband to attach the industrial chipper/shredder to the tractor, which is time consuming. Needless to say I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you don't exceede the recommended width of wood.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Used it within the first few hours of receiving. Half the way of chipping the branches the engine stalled out. There seems to be a wood that is stuck. The only option have is to remove the blade and remove the small piece of dry soft wood. Until that part it worked magnificently. It performed better than I had expected until the stall. I guess I'll have to wait until the weekend to fix it and use again.
customer_reviews.author: Monish

customer_reviews.title: A Miracle
customer_reviews.text: I have a large neglected back yard filled with eight foot tall weeds, end to end. I have tried to bring them under control but it isn't easy with chronic arthritis and very little money. So i bought this and started, one by one. It makes quick work of them . I cut them at the ground and shove them in. And presto. They are perfect mulch. I was wary about assembling it as I never can do that right. But I succeeded first time. I wish I had this a year ago when things started getting out of control.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn M. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Won't work
customer_reviews.text: I put the unit together exactly as instructed and when I went to turn the power on......nothing. I hit the reset switch, still nothing. I was really hoping the reviews would be correct about this unit. Update on previous review: The machine didn't start because the safety part had come off. Once I found that, it started right up and ate a bunch of limbs! This is a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Lara E. Bee

customer_reviews.title: Worked OK, but only once
customer_reviews.text: The first time it seemed to work fine. The second time, it kept jamming. Only putting in 1/4 to 1/2 inch wood and had to unjam it 5 times in 30 minutes. The branches keep getting stuck between the blade and the safety cover on the blade. Tried different sizes, some dry, some green, etc. but nothing seemed to work. Finally just gave up. Contacted their tech support but haven't received a response yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Aeling

customer_reviews.title: If you don't know how to sharpen blades don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: 1. Not capable of chipping the size of branches they claim it can. 2. We discovered, after first use, that the blades were dull. We had to sharpen them for the chipper to work properly. Luckily, we know how to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Santaquin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's working as advertised. You have to sharpen the blade every 2 or 3 usage.
customer_reviews.author: V. Malon

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent way to grind up small branches. It's cheap, compact and works reliably. It will jam though. When that happens it's pretty inconvenient to clear. You have to fully unscrew a fastener knob to open it and fully screw it back in before it will work again. A quicker secure and release mechanism would go very far in improving the user experience.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Lender

customer_reviews.title: Little tricky, but works good
customer_reviews.text: Good product overall. Minor complaint about a design flaw: when you open it up to clear a jam, the safety switch is a blade that comes out of a plug-in to cut power. Totally necessary and a good idea. But the blade shape makes it tricky to get back in when you close it. One review mentions not being able to get it to work after the first time - pretty sure they just missed getting that blade to plug back in. Otherwise, it's a good product. I spent a couple days reducing a brush pile into four bags of mulch with very few problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Good product and impressive customer service
customer_reviews.text: The product works as advertised - chopping shrubbery and small limbs into pieces efficiently. I find it very safe to use and easy to clear out when things back up. When I unpacked and assembled the unit about 6 weeks after receiving it, I noticed that the wheels were missing from the box. I got online with a customer service representative and within less then 24 hours the replacement parts were on their way to me. Great experience with SnowJoe Customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Verena Kallhoff

customer_reviews.title: While it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Used it doing light duty work and it quit after thirty minutes.Called Sun Joe and they were very courteous about sending us a replacement.Can't argue with that!
customer_reviews.author: David M. Moser

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I Bought This
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Sun Joe CJ602E 15A Chipper/Shredder to shred some lightweight prunings. When I buy a piece of equipment I expect it to make a job either faster or easier, or give better results than what I could achieve without it. If I was making mulch, this shredder would give better results than what I can do with my pruning shears. However, my main purpose was just to reduce the bulk before putting it out with my recycle waste each week. I found I can do that faster and easier with my pruning shears. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: jspot6698

customer_reviews.title: Very Capable Chipper
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations going into my search for an electric shredder/chipper, but when I saw the reviews for it I thought that I would give it a chance and I was not disappointed at all. Pros: Small footprint, powerful for it's size, no gas to worry about, start up with the flick of a switch every time. See my video for more info.
customer_reviews.author: Keith K.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are only chipping/shredding twigs, don't buy this. Have a pile of small hackberry limbs (a very soft wood) to chip. Worked fine for awhile then inserted a limb about an inch around (shown in photo), sudden stop, opened the cover to the destruction seen in the photos. Almost everything in this unit is plastic, so it is no wonder it choked and came apart. Don't trust the ad saying up to 1.5 inch limbs. 1/2" or smaller you might be ok. Can not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well first time I used it. Used it on older cuttings (dryer). Second time it did not work as well on fresh cut branches. Third time I used it it stopped working. Nothing stuck in it and fuse is pushed in. This happened 2 days after the return period. It is under warranty so I will have to deal with that now to get it working. Will update as I get the device working.
customer_reviews.author: DC123

customer_reviews.title: It chips!
customer_reviews.text: Works well in getting rid of smaller, straight branches. I've only had it jam once (which was 100% my fault), but it was easy to open and fix. I cannot emphasize how much easier straight, pole-like branches are; length doesn't matter so much. It cannot handle curves in the wood super well (let's say above 30 degrees), nor can it handle any stiff lateral shoots. I find that it has an easier time with drier wood as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca Torres

customer_reviews.title: Does the job very well for an inexpensive unit
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed by the assembly instructions, the screws aren't really needed, the paddle holder is a joke and the hubcaps must be placed just so or they keep falling off. That being said, for the price this thing is a monster and so far has easily shredded anything that will fit in it including hardwood. So while the frills aren't perfect, the guts of the machine are impressive and the volume reduction is ridiculously good. Make sure what you shred is dry and don't try to put in limbs with a bunch of side branches still on and you will probably be very pleased with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Objectivism

customer_reviews.title: Small tool is perfect for small tasks
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device as long as your expectations are reasonable. We use it for chipping small orchard limbs during pruning, the frequent small drops from our poplar trees, and other small yard jobs. It helps us keep things picked up and allows us to use “waste” limbs to our benefit, rather than paying for pickup. It works great for these tasks. The only thing I wish it handled better is shredding leaves. There is no efficient way to get more than a handful through the opening at a time, so this isn’t a viable tool for that task.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin D.

customer_reviews.title: DONT USE FOR MORE THAN 10 MINUTES AT A TIME!
customer_reviews.text: So apparently you can only run this thing for about 10 minutes at time before the motor burns out... It will continue working even if you run it longer than 10 minutes but at a weaker pace / power... It worked great but after a couple of days running it for a couple hours each day it no longer works at full power. I can only use it for roughly 1/3 inch sticks now maybe up to half an inch..
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Kat

customer_reviews.title: Useful if you have a lot of sticks in your yard.
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of sticks in our yard and this made a nice pile of small wood chips for the garden. Not good for sticks with leaves or real small sticks. It is a bit violent when chopping up a stick. We put a plastic mail bucket under to catch the mulch. Not an expensive purchase and a good way to reuse all our sticks. Not good for vines. Does better with dead sticks not freshly cut.
customer_reviews.author: dds

customer_reviews.title: Little work horse!
customer_reviews.text: This chipper does more than I ever expected! It is a work horse that goes and goes. Makes really nice chips. You have to make sure you do follow safety instructions as with any machinery. When chipping dead limbs or branches they can be pulled or broken in your hand and pieces can fly back at you so please pay attention.
customer_reviews.author: Bus-Lady

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job once you finish buying parts that weren't provided!
customer_reviews.text: Don't like that I had to buy nuts for the axlels so I could put the wheels on the thing, nor that I have to write this review! OTHERWISE, it does a good job IF the parts needed to assemble are included in the box. Saying that, STRONGLY SUGGEST IT BE PLUGGED IN TO MAKE SORE IT WORKS BEFORE COMPLETLY ASSEMBLED !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Not good as Leaf mulcher
customer_reviews.text: Arrived poorly boxed with missing parts but returned it because there is no shut to mulch leaves There are two openings 1-2 inches in a rubberflap to accomodate small branches and twigs. Based on small opening it would be laborious to mulch or shred any moderate amount of material. I returned my unit for refund without wasting my time using it
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: Good performance,  great price
customer_reviews.text: Great for light use but be Cautious with the hardwood. Thicker or harder branches easily get stuck in the machine and will damage the blade/engine. I’m giving it a four star considering to design the ease-of-use and the price. It made a lot of sense for our light use instead of hiring someone to haul away all of the branches. I’m creating mulch out of the medium size branches and discarding the very large or very small ones.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Davis

customer_reviews.title: Careful feeding... runs well
customer_reviews.text: I had no issues with this unit, ran full day for three days, with careful feeding. Chips very well and used chips on bare ground. Chips are small. Leaves more like ripped up , some ground up. Had some large 1 1/2 inch did well. Blades inside is two steel blades, metal internal in feeding, cutting area. Looks good to me.
customer_reviews.author: EagleClaw

customer_reviews.title: Useless unless you have thousands of straight sticks
customer_reviews.text: It would take you at least an hour to make a bag-worth of mulch with this, unless you had thousands of straight sticks available. The time and effort here required are not worth it. You have to spend so much time rounding up sticks and breaking them to be straight enough to fit into the opening. Also, the size of the mulch you are making can't be adjusted. This is just producing virtual sawdust for me.
customer_reviews.author: Visith Nguyon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: On my first use it impressed me with its chipping speed and ease. I could get a long branch started, and it would even self-feed while I grabbed the next branch. It hasn’t jammed yet so I can’t say whether it’s easy to unclog. If I had to find one quibble it is that I cannot quite fit a 5-gallon bucket under the chute. Overall it seems better than the similar Harbor Freight chipper I’ve been using.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Medium (55-173-015101-EC) is perfect for covering it up in the yard
customer_reviews.text: Eats everything up to a 1.25 branch. Be sure to trim all horizontal branches first. The Ravenna Round Smoker Cover - Premium Outdoor Cover with Durable and Water Resistant Fabric, Medium (55-173-015101-EC) is perfect for covering it up in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard J. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Handy little tool to have in the shed.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good tool. Did what I bought it for. For the price point and the power level I am happy. It isn't a big chipper, don't expect it to replace such a tool. Still it did great work on the sticks the branches that were littering my back yard. It is useless at leaves, but it makes great mulch from sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud81918

customer_reviews.title: My daughter has 2 trees...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has 2 trees and has endless twigs from these monsters. This little shredder is perfect for the job! Nothing beats sitting on a patio swing shoving twigs in a shredder in the cool hours of the late afternoon!
customer_reviews.author: WANDA

customer_reviews.title: Works fine up to about an inch diameter
customer_reviews.text: This works well to mulch the trimmings from my many big bushes. I am not really staying on top of my bush trimming but this helps by avoiding the need to haul off the trimmings. I think it will do up to an inch or so diameter but is happier with smaller pieces. The resulting mulch works fine in my flower beds.
customer_reviews.author: JimD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tree branch chipper
customer_reviews.text: The chipper exceeded my expectations. It was less expensive to purchase this machine than to rent. Operated chipper for 3 hours, I plugged it 3 times. Turned the machine off, unplugged power and opened up the machine, removed wood plug, closed machine, connected power and restarted. Very easy to unplug, brilliant engineering! I learned how to feed the tree branches to avoid plugs. It chips branches at a very fast rate. I'm looking forward to using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our yard!
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected! It was just want I needed. I chipped 5 huge piles of limbs over two days and it was still going strong after 10 hours of use. I will say it is really designed for smaller limbs. If you get upwards of 1” diameter it can clog easily but I had whole limbs just get sucked right through. It was so satisfying. Would not be good for larger limbs. But it was perfect for our needs. Best purchase I’ve made in a while.
customer_reviews.author: K. McNally

customer_reviews.title: I like it and it does not take up a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: This product did exactly what I wanted. I have a narrow lot in a subdivision with a restrictive HOA. I don't have the option of piling a bunch of brush by my curb. I wanted a chipper but didn't want to tie up a lot of money in a large gas powered machine. This one takes care of the pruning I do. I like it and it does not take up a lot of garage space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Packs a Punch
customer_reviews.text: As long as you're only trying to go through branches <1.5 inches thick and have easy access to a grounded electric outlet this is your machine. I've had it running for 4 hours straight in 90 degree heat and haven't seen any issues. Branches occasionally get stuck but the single screw disassembly makes it pretty easy to clear. Definitely wear a mask while using it as it spews a fair amount of saw dust overtime when cutting through dried wood.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started out OK
customer_reviews.text: Started out OK - then would get "bound up" about every 15 minutes. Would have to stop, unplug, open up, clean out bits and pieces from cutting blade, blade platten, and around platten nut. After about the 10th or 12th time, notice that the nut securing the platten (cutter) wheel was loose! More aggrivation than it was worth. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: It is a giant piece of CRAP!
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I am sure you are thinking " I need to mulch some branches around the house and this is cheap" for your own sanity and frustration, don't do it. I bought this to handle some basic dead vines, yes, vines I was clearing out from my property. This POS cannot handle anything that is nor perfectly straight, its a straight up battle in order to get it to shred anything.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs!
customer_reviews.text: We have a fence along the back of our property that tends to get overgrown with brush from mulberries and other woody plants. This chipper handles this material with ease, including leaves. You have to be a bit careful with too many leaves, though, as it might clog. It's easy enough to clean out, though. The largest branches and pieces of brush I use it for are no larger than an inch. Anything bigger than that, I will cut up for my fire pit. If you've got a lot of fallen tree branches, this is probably not what you want to use. But for small brush and sticks, it does a fantastic job.
customer_reviews.author: Bart L Ping

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the size fool you
customer_reviews.text: Ok at first I thought what piece of you know what did I buy. But after three and a half hours of using it I love the damn thing If you can get the stick in it it will eat it. Now it's slow going but in three and a half hours I have two totes full of chips .
customer_reviews.author: Dan Collins

customer_reviews.title: Not bad so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chipper knowing it was not able to handle anything over 1.5 inch. and it was very inexpensive, but so far I have been happy with whats it's doing.
customer_reviews.author: Scott in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product for chipping tree branches. Powerful blades. It does not work for twigs or thick branches. It helped to make the clean up easy for us. We do not have to drag branches to our unused yard areas anymore. We plan to use the chipped woods as mulch. If someone is willing to do thwle work, it is good product to get free mulch.
customer_reviews.author: Mamta Bhatnagar

customer_reviews.title: Don't be misled by reviews which show it spitting out lots of wood chips
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for many hours now, and I more or less hate it. I'm happy to get the little tiny wood chips it produces, but it takes a lot of effort to get them, so my dreams of cleaning up my yard have dissipated. Not worth the money, time or effort I've spent getting few results.
customer_reviews.author: Jude2004

customer_reviews.title: Does a nice job on smaller pieces of wood.
customer_reviews.text: I had a tough time assembling it. Of course a) I'm male and therefore ignore directions and b) I'm incredibly stupid!
customer_reviews.author: FRANK M.

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to buy this?!
customer_reviews.text: I have waited years to buy one of these chippers thinking there's no way it would be powerful enough to chip anything but the smallest branches. Yes, it's limited, but if it fits this chipper will probably do the job. It's fast, reasonably quiet, and makes quick work of most branches. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: If you’re tempted- do it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool! Efficiently clears small trees. The mulch is rather fine, but can still be considered decorative. It’s significantly faster and easier than a large burn pile. I recommend protective eyewear and a mask for the residual sawdust.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt Do Much
customer_reviews.text: Just does not work with any reliability or strength. I would say if you have thorny rose bushes this might be appropriate. But it bogged down trying to mulch last years 6 foot hollyhocks. I was able to only run one stawk at a time. But it did the live rose bush vines quite well surprisingly.
customer_reviews.author: Bettybakebake

customer_reviews.title: Great chipper for the money
customer_reviews.text: Love this product!!! Great chipper for small diameter branches . Pretty powerful and easy to store and move around .
customer_reviews.author: skotland mic Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Used it 2 times with great success. I don’t have a huge yard
customer_reviews.text: Used it 2 times with great success. I don’t have a huge yard, but have a lot of brush and yard waste every spring and fall. This turned a bunch of branches and shrubs into 15 gallons of shredded chips with ease. I am using the wood chips to mulch my raspberry patch. So much easier than dealing with cutting everything into small enough pieces to fit in yard waste bags and a fraction of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wagle

customer_reviews.title: Does the work but limited
customer_reviews.text: Reason I gave it 4 and not 5 stars is that it is rather limited in what it can handle. It does handle branches but they pretty much have to be straight (no side pieces) and the Sun Joe does not do much with thin pieces. But when you feed it a 1/4- 1 inch or so straight branch, it does chip it nicely. Overall: good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: takema

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was easy. However
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived promptly. I assembled it ( it was missing a spacer for the wheels that I had to make). Assembly was easy. However, when I turned it on it wouldn’t run. I called SUNJOE customer service for support. minutes on hold. They couldn’t provide me with anything else that I hadn’t already done. Now I have to send it back to them and await a replacement unit. We’ll see how that goes Update: ordered a 2nd unit. Worked excellently. Better and easier than the Eco Shredder for a lot less money. Easy to clear jams. Took whatever I through at it up to 1.5”. I was chipping and shredding a laurel hedge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick Work
customer_reviews.text: Great for straight branches without leaves. Leaves, especially wet leaves is nearly impossible to push through. Seems to have plenty of power and very sharp blade disk. Not too noisy either.
customer_reviews.author: g e l

customer_reviews.title: Don't shoot for the moon
customer_reviews.text: This little thing works good for what it does. It can be a little tricky with less straight branches but if you treat it right it can do a good job. It made good chips for our mushroom bed, now if we could just get the chipmunks to pay for their free meal.
customer_reviews.author: William Hascall

customer_reviews.title: Used it to chip small twig for 1 hour, then blades dull
customer_reviews.text: Bought product at 8/1/2020. Item arrived very fast at 8/6/2020. Used it to chip small twig for 1 hour, then motor still run but it started cutting inefficiently due to blades dull. I flipped blade over as recommended in the User manual and again only about 30 minutes and blades were dull. Contacted manufacture for replacement blade.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Good little cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Came promptly, easy to assemble and gets the job done. This is a light duty chipper that helps you get rid of branches up to 1.5 inches thick. Anything bigger than that it cannot handle. I trim the trees around my property multiple times a year and it helps me get rid of the trimmings. The left over mulch has been useful as well as i have been able to use it to fill some flower beds and plant beds with mulch. Its easy to roll it around the yard just get a long electrical cord and you are good. So far i'm pleased with the little chipper.
customer_reviews.author: Elias Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I have several large trees in my yard that provide me with plenty of branches. This chips up the branches fine enough that walking on them bare foot is not an issue. It's perfect for putting these chips between my garden beds just as I had hoped. My neighbors and I have only used it with dry hardwood branches and have had zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Sun Joe CJ602E-RED 15 Amp Electric Wood Chipper/Shredder, Red
product_meta.description: Color:RedQuickly turn your yard debris into nutrient-rich garden mulch and do your part to reduce, reuse and recycle with the Sun Joe electric chipper/shredder. Powered by a robust 15-amp motor, the CJ602E electric wood chipper and shredder generates speeds of up to 4,300 revolutions per minute, making quick work out of the brush, leaves and branches overcrowding your lawn. Designed for light-duty jobs, this wood chipper effectively chips and shreds wooden sticks and limbs up to 1.5-inches thick, reducing your yard waste up to 1/17th its original size. The minimized wood chips resulting from Sun Joe’s efforts are perfect for use as garden mulch around your trees and flower beds. Easy to assemble and virtually maintenance free, the Sun Joe electric chipper and shredder is ready to go when you are. Just plug it in and instantly start chipping! Unlike gas-powered tools, the electric-powered Sun Joe means you don’t have to deal with smoke, fumes, unpredictable starters and costly tune-ups. The CJ602E also features a safety stop that automatically engages when the hopper is opened. The Sun Joe electric wood chipper/shredder is ETL-approved and backed by a full two-year warranty.
feature_bullets: Ideal for turning branches and twigs into nutrient-rich garden mulch
Powerful 15 amp motor effectively chips and shreds branches up to 1.5-Inches thick
Compact design with 6-inch wheels for easy portability
Safety hopper with locking knob prevents the motor from operating when opened
ETL approved; Full 2-year warranty. No load speed (rpm) - 4100 rpm

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars932 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
